framework.name: docker-compose
framework.help: Define and run multi-container applications with Docker.

option.name: --force-rm
option.help: Always remove intermediate containers.

option.name: --no-cache
option.help: Do not use cache when building the image.

option.name: --pull
option.help: Always attempt to pull a newer version of the image.

command.name: bundle
command.help: Generate a Docker bundle from the Compose file

option.name: --push-images
option.help: Automatically push images for any services which have a `build` option specified.

option.name: --output
option.help: Path to write the bundle file to. Defaults to "<project name>.dab".

command.name: config
command.help: Validate and view the compose file

option.name: --quiet
option.help: Only validate the configuration, don't print anything.

option.name: --services
option.help: Print the service names, one per line.

option.name: --force-recreate
option.help: Recreate containers even if their configuration and image haven't changed. Incompatible with --no-recreate.

option.name: --no-recreate
option.help: If containers already exist, don't recreate them. Incompatible with --force-recreate.

option.name: --no-build
option.help: Don't build an image, even if it's missing.

option.name: --build
option.help: Build images before starting containers.

command.name: down
command.help: Stop and remove containers, networks, images, and volumes

option.name: --rmi
option.help: Remove images. Type must be one of: 'all': Remove all images used by any service. 'local': Remove only images that don't have a custom tag set by the `image` field.

option.name: --volumes
option.help: Remove named volumes declared in the `volumes` section of the Compose file and anonymous volumes attached to containers.

option.name: --remove-orphans
option.help: Remove containers for services not defined in the Compose file.

command.name: events
command.help: Receive real time events from containers

option.name: --json
option.help: Output events as a stream of json objects

command.name: exec
command.help: Execute a command in a running container

option.name: -d
option.help: Detached mode: Run command in the background.

option.name: --privileged
option.help: Give extended privileges to the process.

option.name: --user
option.help: Run the command as this user.

option.name: -T
option.help: Disable pseudo-tty allocation. By default `docker-compose exec` allocates a TTY.

option.name: --index
option.help: index of the container if there are multiple instances of a service [default: 1]

option.name: -s
option.help: SIGNAL to send to the container. Default signal is SIGKILL.

option.name: --no-colour
option.help: Produce monochrome output.

option.name: --follow
option.help: Follow log output.

option.name: --timestamps
option.help: Show timestamps.

option.name: --tail
option.help: Number of lines to show from the end of the logs for each container. Use "all" to show all lines.

command.name: port
command.help: Print the public port for a port binding

option.name: --protocol
option.help: tcp or udp [default: tcp]

option.name: --index
option.help: index of the container if there are multiple instances of a service [default: 1]

option.name: -q
option.help: Only display IDs

option.name: --ignore-pull-failures
option.help: Pull what it can and ignores images with pull failures.

option.name: --ignore-push-failures
option.help: Push what it can and ignores images with push failures.

option.name: --timeout
option.help: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds. (default: 10)

option.name: --force
option.help: Don't ask to confirm removal.

option.name: -v
option.help: Remove any anonymous volumes attached to containers

option.name: -d
option.help: Detached mode: Run container in the background, print new container name.

option.name: --name
option.help: Assign a name to the container.

option.name: --entrypoint
option.help: Override the entrypoint of the image.

option.name: -e
option.help: Set an environment variable (can be used multiple times).

option.name: --user
option.help: Run as specified username or uid.

option.name: --no-deps
option.help: Don't start linked services.

option.name: --rm
option.help: Remove container after run. Ignored in detached mode.

option.name: --publish
option.help: Publish a container's port(s) to the host.

option.name: --service-ports
option.help: Run command with the service's ports enabled and mapped to the host.

option.name: -T
option.help: Disable pseudo-tty allocation. By default `docker-compose run` allocates a TTY.

option.name: --workdir
option.help: Working directory inside the container.

command.name: scale
command.help: Set number of containers for a service

option.name: --timeout
option.help: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds. (default: 10)

option.name: --timeout
option.help: Specify a shutdown timeout in seconds. (default: 10)

option.name: -d
option.help: Detached mode: Run containers in the background, print new container names. Incompatible with --abort-on-container-exit.

option.name: --no-color
option.help: Produce monochrome output.

option.name: --no-deps
option.help: Don't start linked services.

option.name: --force-recreate
option.help: Recreate containers even if their configuration and image haven't changed. Incompatible with --no-recreate.

option.name: --no-recreate
option.help: If containers already exist, don't recreate them. Incompatible with --force-recreate.

option.name: --no-build
option.help: Don't build an image, even if it's missing.

option.name: --build
option.help: Build images before starting containers.

option.name: --abort-on-container-exit
option.help: Stops all containers if any container was stopped. Incompatible with -d.

option.name: --timeout
option.help: Use this timeout in seconds for container shutdown when attached or when containers are already running. (default: 10)

option.name: --remove-orphans
option.help: Remove containers for services not defined in the Compose file.

option.name: --short
option.help: Shows only Compose's version number.
